abstract: Book business is upending its traditional timetable by encouraging a kind of binge reading, releasing new works by a single author at an accelerated pace; practice of spacing an author's books at least one year apart is gradually being discarded as publishers appeal to the same 'must-know-now' impulse that drives binge viewing of some television series.
lead_paragraph: While the television industry has begun catering to impatient audiences by releasing entire series at once, the book business is upending its traditional timetable by encouraging a kind of binge reading, releasing new works by a single author at an accelerated pace.

headline.main: Impatience Has Its Reward: Books Are Rolled Out Faster
